problem.markdown:
We are trying to find a student in a sorted list of student names. The list has length N. What's the worst-case running time as a function of the size of N? ( ) Constant (x) Logarithmic ( ) Linear ( ) Quadratic ( ) Exponential
[explanation] Just like the number guessing game (I think of a number from 1-100, and you have 7 guesses to guess a number and I'll tell you whether you were too low, too high, or you got it), you can divide and conquer -- start at the middle, and cut the problem in half with every wrong guess. This yields a logarithmic running time. As an aside, log2(100)=6.64..., which is why you can always win the 1-100 guessing game in 7 guesses, and (if I'm allowed to move my number around), can NEVER win the 1-100 guessing game in 6 guesses.
